rows.title: An emergency

introduction.eng:
**Are you in need of emergent assistance?**

📞  Police (SAPS): 10111

📞 Emergency Line: 112

📞 Ambulance: 10177

📞  Fire Department: 10177

📞 Crime Stop (South African Police Service): 0860 010 111

📞  General: 0800 4357 4 8

rows.introduction:

rows.title: A challenge with alcohol or drugs

title.eng: A challenge with alcohol or drugs

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about challenges you or a loved one are experiencing with alcohol or drugs?**

**Alcoholics Anonymous (AA)**
AA offers free, anonymous support for people who want to stop drinking. Meetings take place across South Africa.
📞 National Helpline (24/7): 0861 435 722
🌐 www.aasouthafrica.org.za

**Al-Anon Family Groups**
Al-Anon supports anyone affected by a loved one’s drinking. Meetings are free, safe, and confidential.
📞 National Helpline: 086 125 2666
🌐 www.alanon.org.za

**Nar-Anon Family Groups**
Nar-Anon provides support to family and friends of people struggling with drug addiction.
📞 National Helpline: 088 129 6791
🌐 www.naranon.org.za

**South African National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence (SANCA)**
SANCA offers help with prevention, counselling, and treatment for substance use.
📞 General: 011 892 3829
📞 WhatsApp call: 076 535 1701
🌐 www.sancanational.info

**Department of Social Development (DSD)**
The DSD helpline offers free 24/7 support for substance use and other social issues.
📞 Helpline: 0800 121 314
📩 SMS: 32312

**WhatsApp Chat Line – National Substance Abuse Helpline**
A free WhatsApp chat line for information and support around alcohol or drugs.
📱 WhatsApp: 087 163 2025 (8am–5pm)

rows.title: A legal problem

introduction.eng:
**Do you need legal assistance?**

**Black Sash Helpline**
Black Sash offers free advice on social grants, legal rights, and government services.
📞 Call or WhatsApp: 072 663 3739 / 063 610 1865
🌐 www.blacksash.org.za

**Legal Aid South Africa**
Legal Aid provides free legal services for low-income individuals across many legal issues.
📞 0800 110 110
📩 Send a 'please call me' to: 079 835 7179
🌐 www.legal-aid.co.za

**Refugee Rights Unit – UCT Law Clinic**
Offers legal advice and support for asylum seekers and refugees in South Africa.
📱 WhatsApp (for status): 072 499 8146
📱 WhatsApp (for rights): 078 594 5591
🌐 www.refugeerights.uct.ac.za

**South African Social Security Agency (SASSA)**
SASSA provides information about social grants and who qualifies for support.
🌐 www.sassa.gov.za 
(Click the ‘Social Grants’ tab to review your options)

rows.title: Feeling unsafe at home or in my relationship

title.eng: Feeling unsafe at home or in my relationship

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about feeling unsafe in your home or with your partner?**

**South African Depression and Anxiety Group (SADAG)**
SADAG offers emotional support and referrals for people in distress, including those feeling unsafe at home.
📞 0800 567 567
🌐 www.sadag.org (Online support groups available)

**Gender-Based Violence (GBV) Command Centre**
The GBV helpline offers 24/7 support for anyone experiencing abuse or violence.
📞 0800 428 428
📩 Send a ‘please call me’ to: *120*7867#

rows.introduction:

📞 0800 428 428
📩 Send a ‘please call me’ to: *120*7867#

rows.title: A referral related to violence

introduction.eng:
**Do you need to find referrals for challenges relating to violence**?

**Crime Stop (South African Police Service)**
Report crimes or suspicious activity anonymously.
📞 0860 010 111

**Childline South Africa**
Free 24/7 support for children and anyone concerned about a child’s safety.
📞 116
🌐 www.childlinesa.org.za

**Gender-Based Violence (GBV) Command Centre**
24/7 help for anyone experiencing abuse or gender-based violence.
📞 0800 428 428
📩 Send a ‘please call me’ to: *120*7867#

**Thuthuzela Care Centres (TCCs)**
Support for survivors of rape and sexual violence, including medical care and counselling.
🌐 Find your nearest TCC: www.gov.za/TCC

**Safeline (Male Survivor Helpline)**
Confidential support for boys and men affected by sexual abuse or violence.
📞 0800 035 553

Refugee Support (Scalabrini Centre)
Legal and psychosocial help for refugee children and families.
📱 WhatsApp (children): 063 656 5080
📱 WhatsApp (refugee rights): 078 594 5591
🌐 www.scalabrini.org.za

rows.title: A challenge in my family

introduction.eng:
**Do you need more information or support in managing a challenge in your family?**

**Department of Social Development (DSD)**
Offers support with family issues, child welfare, and elder care. 
📞 0800 220 250 (Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm)
🚩 Visit your local DSD office (Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm)

**ACVV (Afrikaanse Christelike Vroue Vereniging)**
Supports families in crisis through social work, child protection, and community services.
🌐 www.acvv.org.za

**Badisa**
Faith-based organisation offering social support for families, children, the elderly, and people with disabilities.
🌐 www.badisa.org.za

**Childline South Africa**
24/7 helpline for children or families needing support, guidance, or to report abuse.
📞 116
🌐 www.childlinesa.org.za

rows.title: Feelings of anxiety or sadness

introduction.eng:
**Do you have questions about what to do if you or a loved one may be feeling sad or anxious?**

South African Depression and Anxiety Group (SADAG)
Offers free mental health support, counselling, and referrals for adults and teens.
📞 0800 567 567
🌐 www.sadag.org

Lifeline South Africa
Provides 24/7 counselling and emotional support for anyone in distress.
📞 0861 322 322
📱 WhatsApp call: 065 989 9238
🌐 www.lifeline.org.za

Childline South Africa
Free helpline for children and young people needing emotional support or help.
📞 116
🌐 www.childlinesa.org.za

rows.title: A health referral

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about your health questions?**

**AIDS Helpline (National Department of Health)**
Free, confidential support on HIV, treatment, testing, and prevention.
📞 0800 012 322

**Cancer Association of South Africa (CANSA)**
Support, screening info, and referrals for cancer-related health concerns.
📞 0800 226 622
🌐 www.cansa.org.za

**Marie Stopes South Africa**
Support for family planning, abortion, and sexual health.
📞 0800 117 785
🌐 www.mariestopes.org.za

**Lifeline South Africa**
Counselling for sexual health, relationships, and unplanned pregnancy.
📞 0861 322 322
🌐 www.lifeline.org.za

**Termination of Pregnancy Services**
Public info on safe and legal abortion options.
📞 Department of Health 012 395 8000 
🌐 https://www.gov.za/services/services-residents/birth/terminate-pregnancy

**Men’s Sexual Health (including circumcision)**
Ask the professional nurse at your local clinic for free advice and services.

rows.title: A disability

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to find someone to talk to for support regarding disability?**

Department of Social Development (DSD)
Provides disability grants, support services, and referrals through offices across South Africa.
📞 Contact your local DSD office

National Disability WhatsApp Support Line
General guidance and referrals for all disabilities.
📱 WhatsApp: 081 517 8757
🌐 www.wcapd.org.za (based in Western Cape, assists nationally)

South African Disability Alliance (SADA)
A national network of organisations supporting persons with disabilities across different sectors.
🌐 www.sada.org.za

BlindSA
Offers support, advocacy, and accessible resources for blind and visually impaired persons.
📞 Helpline: 060 967 0258
🌐 www.blindsa.org.za

Autism South Africa
Information, resources, and guidance for families and individuals living with autism.
🌐 www.aut2know.co.za

rows.title: A school challenge

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to find someone to talk to for support regarding school challenges?**

SA School Helpline (Department of Basic Education)
Offers advice on school registration, bullying, rights, and other school-related issues.
📞 0800 202 933

rows.introduction:
**Would you like to find someone to talk to for support regarding school challenges?**

SA School Helpline (Department of Basic Education)
Offers advice on school registration, bullying, rights, and other school-related issues.
📞 0800 202 933

rows.title: Quick Parenting Tips

introduction.eng: Raising teens can be hard and we all struggle sometimes.

quiz_1_question.eng: What is the main challenge you are experiencing right now?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: My relationship with my teen is not good

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: I worry about my teen’s safety

quiz_1_option_6_text.eng: We often fight in our family

rows.introduction: Raising teens can be hard and we all struggle sometimes.
rows.quiz_1_question: What is the main challenge you are experiencing right now?
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: My relationship with my teen is not good
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: I worry about my teen’s safety
rows.quiz_1_option_6_text: We often fight in our family

rows.introduction: Building a better relationship starts with spending time together - even 5 minutes a day makes a difference! At first, it can be hard to spend time together, as we are all busy and our teens can be in a bad mood sometimes. But spending even 5 minutes a day of focused time with your teen helps to build trust. Try asking your teen what they would like to do together. It can be fun and relaxing for you too!

introduction.eng: Building a better relationship starts with spending time together - even 5 minutes a day makes a difference! At first, it can be hard to spend time together, as we are all busy and our teens can be in a bad mood sometimes. But spending even 5 minutes a day of focused time with your teen helps to build trust. Try asking your teen what they would like to do together. It can be fun and relaxing for you too!

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support on how to spend one-on-one time with your teen here:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support on how to spend one-on-one time with your teen here:

rows.introduction: All teenagers sometimes behave just horribly! One thing that can help with teenage behaviour is to praise them any time that they do something good – however small. Teens may not look like they want or seek your praise but they still really, really do.

introduction.eng: All teenagers sometimes behave just horribly! One thing that can help with teenage behaviour is to praise them any time that they do something good – however small. Teens may not look like they want or seek your praise but they still really, really do.

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support here on how to encourage good behaviour through praising:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support here on how to encourage good behaviour through praising:

rows.introduction: Parenting stress is really high right now. We know exactly how overwhelming life can be. Doing something for yourself can reduce your stress. You deserve it! And when you feel overwhelmed, take back control over your body by taking five slow, deep breaths before responding. Lots of parents found this helpful.

introduction.eng: Parenting stress is really high right now. We know exactly how overwhelming life can be. Doing something for yourself can reduce your stress. You deserve it! And when you feel overwhelmed, take back control over your body by taking five slow, deep breaths before responding. Lots of parents found this helpful.

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support on how to take care of yourself here:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support on how to take care of yourself here:

rows.introduction: You are not alone. Money stress is so hard for parents. Try talking to your teen about how much money comes in and what you need to spend money on as a family each month. This can help them to understand why you cannot afford something they want. And when everyone understands where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save together too!

introduction.eng: You are not alone. Money stress is so hard for parents. Try talking to your teen about how much money comes in and what you need to spend money on as a family each month. This can help them to understand why you cannot afford something they want. And when everyone understands where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save together too!

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support on how to budget and save here:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support on how to budget and save here:

rows.introduction: Teens spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe - many parents worry about this. Try to start a conversation with your teen about safe and unsafe places in your community and online (you might need to try a few times). They may even know some you do not. This can start to help you make a plan together about how to stay safe.

introduction.eng: Teens spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe - many parents worry about this. Try to start a conversation with your teen about safe and unsafe places in your community and online (you might need to try a few times). They may even know some you do not. This can start to help you make a plan together about how to stay safe.

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support on how to keep your teen safe here:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support on how to keep your teen safe here:

rows.introduction: When a problem comes up, try to talk about it together. What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.

introduction.eng: When a problem comes up, try to talk about it together. What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.

introduction_2.eng: You can get more support on how to solve problems together here:

rows.introduction_2: You can get more support on how to solve problems together here:
